bio:treatment.discussion: Variety chlorothamnus is closely related to var. subaridum and is known only from scattered populations on the eastern slope of the Sierra Nevada in Inyo, southern Mono, and northeastern Tulare counties. Frequently it grows with var. nevadense, and mixed collections may be encountered in herbaria. The plants do well in cultivation and certainly are worthy of a place in the garden.
